description:
Great local boston sports bar. 
Very friendly and welcoming. 
I would come back if wasnt visiting
author: Mike C.

description:
A decent neighborhood dive bar with a good selection of craft brews and a full bar. There's no food, but there are plenty of options nearby, and you can bring your own in.

Perhaps the best feature about this place - one that warrants a bump up from 3 stars to 4 - is its Boston theme. There's a nice outdoor patio in the back with one wall painted to look like the Green Monster at Fenway Park and another with a Patriots-logo bottlecap mural.

Great to know that there's a home away from home for all us native Ma**holes! ;)
author: Vincent L.

description:
All and all a very nice watering hole. It's nothing fancy, but not that type of bar where you are afraid you might get shivved in the toilet. Lots of stuff on the walls, this place has character.

Drinks aren't too expensive. This is a Boston bar, so during sports events that will be the team that everyone is rooting for. It's nice to have something authentic like this so near to the tourist nightmare that is Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Wes T.

description: Old school pub.  Has the east coast charm of a "belly-up" bar.  Staff was great!  Locals fill the place and understandably so....  Enjoy a beverage here after walking the streets in San Francisco.
author: Dave W.

description:
I really enjoyed this bar! It was a hop, skip and a jump from my AirBnB and I'm glad it was.

One of the smaller bars I visited in SF. However, it was the perfect size in my opinion. Not huge, but not tiny. You had enough room so that you weren't rubbing elbows with the person next to you but it didn't feel overwhelming. There wasn't a large crowd of people in there this night. However, you could tell that this was their local watering hole.

The bartender was great! She poured a nice drink and had a great sense of humor. As soon as we sat down she was chatting with us, cracking jokes and even giving us tips on places to go in the city while we were there. She was just as awesome with everyone else in there and you could tell she's a big reason people were coming in. 

The drinks were good and the prices were even better. We didn't stay long but we enjoyed our time there. Next time I'm back in the neighborhood, I will definitely stumble my way back in for a cold one.
author: Zoe F.

description:
A dive bar right next to those tourist trap piers?? The bathrooms are uncannily clean. The drinks are strong, and the vibes are positive. 

Unless you hate the Patriots. It's all bad vibes if you hate the pats. Lol jk about that, good vibes here
author: Alex I.

description: Went there on 4th of July evening. For such a small place we had to wait nearly 15 minutes to order drinks and they were not even that busy considering the holiday.
author: Samuel C.

description:
A neighborhood bar in a touristy neighborhood, The Red Jack Saloon exudes plenty of its own charm. 

If you're a fan of Boston sports teams, this is your spot. Daily drinks specials and a nice selection of brews on tap. The interior of the bar feels a little dated but the patio area is nice to spend a lazy afternoon if the sun's out. Check out the huge Patriot's mural made out of bottle caps! Typically friendly bartenders serve you and a big plus that they take cards too. 

The Red Jack Saloon is a neighborhood stalwart for thirsty locals and home-sick Bostonians.
author: Jon L.

description: Great place for non locals to swing by and have a drink. Prices are cheap, service is great.
author: Jeremy D.

description:
I managed to wander in to a Boston 'neighborhood bar' in San Francisco and couldn't be happier! The tourist crowds nearby were too much to bear making us wander a few blocks away before checking for 'nearby' bars on Yelp. We were about a block away and headed over.
I have to admit, from the outside it looks a bit 'seedy' making me second guess my decision. The inside is a perfect dive bar with a smiling bartender chatting with customers, a couple playing darts in the back, a few folks at the bar drinking beer, watching a game. Laid back perfection.
The drink prices were good with a good selection of beers and liquors. Red Sox and Celtic banners adorn the walls. Restrooms are clean and although I didn't look, there seems to be a space 'out back'. The owners, both from 'Mass', moved to and met in, California. Missing a bit of home they opened a neighborhood bar. I sure am glad they did.
author: Jen W.

description: Great bar. Great music on the Juke box. Sports on the tv. Great drinks. Fun and laid back atmosphere. They even had a Tupperware of phone chargers that you can borrow while drinking.
author: Sam W.

description: Great spot in downtown SF! The bartender was super friendly and attentive. Every time we went up to the bar he came right over. Nice atmosphere inside and very clean. They have darts, board games, and even a classic table video game set that you can play PAC man, donkey kong, frogger, etc. on. They have a juke box too so you can play your own music. They had the Giants game on all the TVs when we went in too. Overall an awesome laid back spot if you're looking to hang out for the night!
author: Emily M.

description:
Perfect place to watch a game even if it is at 1:00 pm EST. if you're a Boston's sport team fan then this is the place to be when traveling to San Francisco.

Beer is cheap, great atmosphere and great people
author: Lady R.

description:
My new local hangout bar when in San Francisco. Nick is a great bartender, just make sure to bring your ID regardless of age. We met lots of great people, locals and tourists. 
See you guys in a couple of years.
author: Rob M.

description: Just stoped in for drinks just a little out of the way bar makes you feel like you are at home.we had a good time bar tender was great
author: Laura G.

description: Went there this past weekend and was not disappointed. The bartender Mark was super friendly and was very knowledgeable about most thing in the SF area. In fact this bar was so good I went there again the next night. Great place with just the right amount of people. I will definitely go back if I'm ever in SF again.
author: Christopher S.

description:
We came in here right after they opened on Saturday to watch the soccer game (definitely weren't lurking on the corner waiting for 1pm like alcoholics..........) What I gathered was an/the owner welcomed us in and was super super friendly. We got beers and then later a few of their $6 weekend bloody mary's. Bloody Mary's were done RIGHT. The night before my fiance got a bloody mary that was literally vodka with tomato juice, but these were tasty and the spiciness was just right. I think my fiance drank 3 of them he liked them so much. 

This seems like a cool neighborhood bar, loved the woman who made our drinks and if I were living in North Beach I'd definitely want to go there on the reg. Interestingly they're a Patriots/Redskins bar, but I'm happy to see some East Coast love either way. Also I'm a falcons fan and she told me that they have one Falcons fan who gets his own TV on Sundays.
author: Christine U.

description: I always love places that jump on you, as an almost 50 year old man to check your ID then ignore you for 15 minutes. 4 of us out and down the road. I gave them 2 stars since the lights were on, but nobody home.
author: Mark C.

description: This is exactly what you want in a neighborhood bar. A friendly and attentive bartender with good drink prices and plenty of sports on the tv. The place is clean, including the restrooms, and an entire spectrum of folks hangs out in this establishment. Nick was great and added to the atmosphere of a fun night out!
author: Sara B.

description: Great redskins bar. Good vibes. Free hot dogs. Sometimes they have specials but in general the beers aren't too expensive. It's also a Pats bar I think.
author: Nitesh D.

description:
There's a local vibe about this bar that's so close to the waterfront activity (Wharf & Embarcadero).  Unlike the Jefferson St restaurant bars, this little joint seems to be a rest stop for those who just clocked out and nearby residents out for some socializing.

No food here, just booze.  The small bar seats a few on stools and the low top tables with chairs and the former church pew along the wall seat a few more.  I saw one video game, a digital jukebox, a dart board, and a number of TV's (6?) for viewing the current sports broadcast (basketball and football on this evening) - don't get too comfortable, the games switch TV's; makes things moving I suppose.  There's a small patio in the rear with a couple picnic tables.

I liked this place, in part, because of the lack of pomp & circumstance that touristas have come to expect.  It's a clean divey bar.  It was a nice place to sit down, relax, drink a couple, and watch a game.  Order pizza to be delivered, if you're hungry.  It is slightly residential with neighbors living quarters next door on both sides.  Be polite and keep the riot quiet when out front.

Service was ok at best.  Ordering at the bar and getting the tenders attention was a task.  He didn't seem to notice peeps waiting to order unless flailing their arms for attention.  

I'll be sure to remember it's here for the next time I'm walking the wharf area and just want to sneak away for a calm beverage.
author: John H.

description: Refused service to me and a friend. No explanation, refused to accept our out of state license. We were there to celebrate with some coworkers and they refused to let us even stay with just cokes. Completely kicked us out
author: Alli D.

description:
One of the only bars in the city where you can not only watch the skins play but you are surrounded by Redskin fans!

The drinks are cheap for a tourist based area and they also serve free hot dogs and meatball sandwiches!

Definitely worth checking out.

The only downside is the street parking. The car we parked behind had two smashed in windows so make sure you don't leave any valuables behind.
author: Shay I.

description: Pretty cozy and well located bar. Decent selection of beer. Friendly staff. Overall cheap drinks, attentive bartenders, and great mix of people that makes the atmosphere awesome.
author: Maeve M.

description: Just got off work in a new town and this place is exactly what the doctor ordered. All the comforts of a dive bar from home with enough characters to make the night eventful. Also nice to find affordable beer and cocktails in this expensive, tourist city.
author: Ashley O.

description: This place rocks for a local. Tourists...stay away!
author: Wayne D.

description:
I've lived across the street from this place for nearly two years now... and finally visited this place a couple of weeks ago. Ah, shame on me.

It is a dive bar complete with cheap strong drinks, dart board with Trump's face on it and other board games. Kudos to the single bartender who took care of the entire busy bar.

It was a fun time!
author: Mingmei N.

description: Mark and lorie are amazing people. This is my local watering hole and I love coming here. Nick and Nicole are wonderful bartenders. Oh yeah, they have a multicade cocktail table with donkey kong. Definitely my home away from home. Don't even try battling me at donkey kong...
author: iLLusiveFX s.

description: Great service, clean bathrooms. Fabulous neighborhood atmosphere and Jessica is the best. Very attentive and caring.
author: William M.

description:
3 stars for beer list:  They had standard American Beers on tap along with some craft beers - I was happy they had Lagunitas IPA on tap. 

5 Stars HTTR!  Redskins bar away from home!  The only one we could find in San Fran.  On a Sunday night game, despite a disappointing Skins season, I was impressed to find so many skins fans at the bar in Burgundy and Gold attire.  

2 stars Ambience:  The ambience is nothing too exciting - your standard American pub with an "L" shaped wooden bar parallel to some tables along the length.  We sat at the short side of the bar and there was a bit of a strange but tolerable odor in my corner.   

0 stars and 4 stars (hit or miss) Service:  Our first bartender seemed annoyed we were there, asked what we wanted and walked away (barely anyone at the bar) when we took a 10 second pause to peruse the beer list.  When I asked if there was a food menu, he remarked that they don't have a kitchen and then plopped a big binder of delivery menus in front of us.  We ordered food from a nearby takeout place.  10 minutes later, another bar patron right next to us asked the same question and got a different answer, "There will be a free hot dog station behind you, but you can order delivery, too."    I would have never ordered delivery if I knew that.  SERIOUSLY ANNOYED.  Our second bartender was much better, friendly, and welcomed our presence.
author: Karena J.

description: Mark and his lovely wife are  fantastic hosts and Bartenders. Mark makes a killer jack and the giant peach shot...even when he just learned to make them.  Mark makes you feel as if you are at your local home dive bar... No Matter how far away you are.
author: Jess M.

description: Nicole is the best bartender ever. 10/10 recommend this place and her. She's the only reason I am writing this review
author: Yo Yo M.

description:
Awesome Boston sports bar.  The owners are from Massachusetts and you can always count on a great crowd for the Pats games!  There are lots of diehard Boston fans in the neighborhood and they all come out to the Red Jack for games.

Been going here for years and have watched some awesome Boston sports runs including the last 5 years of the Patriots, 2013 Red Sox World Series run, Bruins and Celtics playoff runs.

Tips:  No kitchen, but the owners put out hot dogs / sausages / meatballs (if you're lucky) for Sunday football.  You can order in takeout very easily to your table.  Good TVs.  Always have the sound on for the big Boston games.
author: Tim P.

description: This bar has a great Boston feel! Stopped by to get a couple of drinks with a friend of mine from Boston. He loved it! The walls are all covered with sports swag. There is a different type of 'happy hour' offered all day. Great service!!
author: Halley N.

description: Great place to stop in for a beer or two or six...Friendly owner who is attentive but doesn't bother you. Great place to chill and catch a game
author: Pooyie Y.

description: Friendly neighborhood bar. Great vibe. Perfect spot for a cool drink on a warm summer afternoon.
author: Denise F.

description:
WAAARRIIOOORS! 

If you're looking for a spot to watch the Warriors game with a lively Warriors-loving Crowd, then Red Jack Saloon is your spot. With cheap drinks, a fun clientele and a bunch of big screen TVs makes for the perfect sport-watching atmosphere.  Located a few minutes from Fisherman's Warf, down the street from Trader Joe's and Safeway, the location of Red Jack Saloon is pretty central. The bar is not over crowded and the customers are mainly locals. 

Now what are you waiting for? Get out there and support The Warriors and stop by The Red Jack Saloon for a pint or two..
author: Aletta B.

description:
The female bartender with brown hair is really rude. I tried to be understanding she was the only bartender and there was no bar back or any help. This was on a Saturday night :-/ but service was slow and it was hard to get a drink. She didn't help with her attitude either. don't take it out on your customers. Anyway
-2 coronas and a gin/tonic were $17. 
-We got to play Jenga which was cool! There was other games as well.
author: Annabelle S.

description: the owner of this establishment is the most disrespectful person ive ever come in contact with. My phone number is written on a jenga piece in their bar and ive been being harrassed on the phone for over a year because of it and when i called to ask him to remove it he refused and hung up on me multiple times. I cant believe any owner would act that way to a customer.
author: Sara M.

description: First time here visiting San Fran Nick was amazing. Had a great time played connect four and the shots were well worth the money whiskey Wednesday def know my go to spot next time.
author: Felicia D.

description: Petty much a standard divey bar.  We stopped in after going to see the sea lions and noticed a smell immediately.  Was it mold? Maybe spilled beer in the carpet/floor? Either way wasn't a pleasant smell but didn't bother us too much.  When the bartender was pouring our beers the keg went out and that beer was on the house, which was nice of her.  Or maybe that's standard bartender gestures?  Not sure but I wasn't going to complain!  She also advised that a pitcher was be same price as three beers but was the better deal so  he next round we had was the pitcher.  Pretty cool chill place to watch the Giants play.  We came late afternoon but I'm sure it could get a bit rowdy at night.
author: Nyla K.

description: Great service and great prices. Highly recommended to anyone leaving fisherman's warf looking to have a great night.
author: Josh R.

description:
I've had Yelp for a while but this is one of the first reviews I've left. The red jack saloon will forever be my favorite bar in San Francisco. 

I was in town for my birthday and my friend and I were looking for a good spot to just go and have a few beers before heading to our hotel. When we walked in it looked empty but we didn't mind that at all. Once we sat down and placed our orders w very friendly couple made conversation with us. Turns out they were the owners.

The owners made us feel extremely welcomed. They even bought me a birthday shot. And they introduced us to all the regulars and before a we knew it we were laughing and drinking with the entire bar. This is truly a neighborhood bar and I strongly recommend everyone check it out.
author: Juan A.

description: Great Boston bar! I grew up in Mass & live in Vegas.. came to San Fran to visit & ended up in the AWESOME little watering hole. Strong drinks & a great vibe. Felt right at home here. I swear the owners are my family, because that's how they make you feel here. I highly recommend you check it out! Laurie is my girl! Love her!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Some fun facts about this bar: 

- They have $4 basic spirits (aka well drinks) on a Thursday
- The bar lady was super friendly and welcoming
- They do soft drink refills for free
- There was a jukebox
- They have Ms Pacman
- It's close to the departure point for Alcatraz but is very much a local bar and not touristy at all

This is one of the coolest bars we visited in San Fran. I liked the vibe, enjoyed having somewhere to relax and the patrons were friendly. Thank Yelp for this place, otherwise I'm sure we'd ended up at some awful tourist trap nearby.
author: Briony C.

description: Stopped in for a drink when we were in the city recently. Bartenders were not friendly. Had to ask a couple of times for things we ordered. I can understand if it was super busy but only a handful of people in the bar.
author: Mindy H.

description:
They treat you like family here! Such a great vibe, and the happy hour specials are awesome!

Such a great neighborhood bar.
author: Angelica K.

description: Fisherman's wharf is crawling with tourists. And this place has a few as well but just a few by comparison. Oh, and there is no stench of fried fish!  All good reasons to walk 2 blocks and have a beer here.  Friendly service. Good selection. Local crowds can be a serious issue at the end of the work day.
author: Philip S.

description:
A MUST for New Englanders in the San Fran area. 
Dive bar representing New England! 
It's home away from home!
Great bar and prices.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Stopped by here because I needed to rinse my mouth out from the Dewar's tasting at Fort Mason Center. My friends and I enjoyed Johnnie Walker Black on the rocks. MUCH better than any of the Dewar's products.

Actually, whenever I am in the area, I stop at The Red Jack Saloon. The place is always fun with lively characters coming through. 

I have gone to the Red Jack for the last two years. Each year taking special care to make their annual Xmas fundraiser. 

This place is a great community gem that goes above and beyond what is required for good business in SF. It is a pleasure to support such a great establishment with great employees and great owners.

I'd highly recommend that you stop by and show your support, if you are in the area.
author: Mark H.

description: Wish I could give this less than a star. Haven't even stepped into the place and the owner was already a jackass. Simple request, now might have a lawsuit cause of it... good move mark
author: Julio V.

description:
Nice friendly workers, this bar is really alive and active. 
On the plus side had some really good pizza delivered from Goodfellas Pizzeria down the street, it was quick and tasty appetizers to go with my beer. Ask the bartender for a flyer to order :)
author: Nade L.

description: Stopped by while in town, Jack hooked us up, dirty martini for 8 bucks! couldn't beat it, the other place charged 13 each.
author: Freddy A.

description: We were in San Francisco for the weekend during the NBA Finals. So my BF needed to see the game. I like to experience life like the locals when I'm traveling, so I googled this spot that was just a couple of blocks away from our hotel. the Sheraton. The place is really small, but to accommodate the extra people, they put out folding chairs and tray tables. It seemed a little janky, but it worked and we were able to sit down comfortably. They have multiple TV's and good bar setup with wines, beers, and hard liquor. Prices were fair.
author: Lolita K.

description:
We had the best time here!! We're from LA and had finished a scenic tour to Alcatraz when we realized a bunch of great games were on. We walked over to Peir 39 for Clam Chowder and were HORRIFIED by the tourists!!! I immediately got on Yelp mobile to see what other places were walking distance. Thank you Yelp!! Red Jack's is only 2 blocks away... and pretty much AWESOME!!

Laurie was bartending and after 45 minutes I could tell she had some sort of ownership in the place. You just don't come across friendly service like that often. I was talking to my husband and mentioned that my phone was going to die. She asked if it was an iphone and let me use her charger!! (I don't think this is available as a regular service) How nice is that!?!?!?!?

We played all sorts of games; darts, jenga, Simpsons pin ball, connect 4, some funny board game. They have a digital juke box and a sweet vibe. My husband said his drink was quite strong. (Which makes him happy!)

I can't wait to go back to SF and hang out with my new buddies while swigging a Guinness! :)
author: Hannah M.

description:
A Redskins bar in San Francisco!  I was sold as soon as I walked in here. The atmosphere was great for a DC fan when they were playing the 49ers, but even the 9er fans here were super respectful and fun. The have many tvs all over the bar, their price points are solid, and they had free hot dogs and meatballs going. 

There is an outdoor patio, a jukebox, a Ms. Pacman machine going, and a dart board among other things. The energy was perfect for a football sunday, energetic, yet no sense of animosity between people. It was a very welcoming crowd.
author: Collin C.

description: Stumbled into this place after our Alcatraz cruise and boy are we glad!  Before ordering anything the bartender offered us some free pizza that had just been delivered.  The service doesn't get much better than that!  It's a really cool local watering hole that's a short walk from fishermens wharf.
author: Rachel S.

description:
If dive bars are your thing, you'll be very happy with Red Jack Saloon.

We attended on a Friday night. We'd just finished dinner at Pier 39 with some friends who were visiting for the weekend. The tourist thing is fine for dinner and shopping, but I wasn't about to drink there. A quick Google Maps search for "Dive Bar" leads me 3 blocks to Red Jack Saloon, and what a bulls-eye that was.

The bartender was friendly, welcomed us, and took our drink orders as soon as we were ready. We all started with delightfully stiff vodka sodas for $4 a piece, a pretty unbeatable price in the city. I eventually switched to my favorite Belgian beer (Palm) that I was so surprised and pleased to find stocked here, also for $4 a piece.

The place is small, quiet, cozy, good dive-y atmosphere. We grabbed a table by the front window to visit and were really comfortable the whole night. There's really not a lot more to tell - friendly bartender, friendly atmosphere, stiff drinks, good prices. A+ if you're looking for a dive bar.
author: Alex L.

description: We were recommended to stop by here to grab a few drinks.  Just your average neighborhood bar atmosphere.  It's definitely a Boston friendly bar, which is fine, but not when your Atlanta Hawks are playing them...hahah.  We had a good time though.
author: Ashley R.

description: Best horrible(not) service ever! :) treats you like family; dances with you to random songs. Chad is an amazing bartender. Very friendly very nice and not Irish lol. Bring yourself here, and have an awesome time!
author: Christopher W.

description:
Awesome bar!!! Owned by Mass. natives and now live in San Fran for 15+ years, very pub feel. 
Great drinks, the owner is amazing and even recommended 21st amendment by the giants stadium for a next bar on our trip. Very cool. 

We were lost trying to find it since it's a bit of hole in the wall and someone across the street told us where to go. Thank you stranger! We had a lot of nice strangers all over the city help us LA people get around.

Thank you San Fran and thank you Red Jack Saloon owners!
author: Harlow H.

description:
Local vibe. Very accommodating. Friendly staff and a chill demeanour. 

No kitchen but you can order food and bring it in. They also have phone chargers.
author: Kyle D.

description: Came to watch the final four games and was greeted with the warmth of family. This is a very local dive bar where everyone knows everybody. It was very low key where the drinks are strong and good. The staff was caring and sweet. This a a great place to get away and watch a game or hang out while having a drink. There is a great back patio as well.
author: Ashley J.

description: Good spot that serves as a pseudo Redskins bar! It's also a Boston bar but that can be forgiven.They don't have food but allow you to bring in your own. They also have hot dogs and wings provided for free by the bar. Drinks are cheap and not many tourists around. Love this place.
author: Oscar P.

description:
It's the perfect place to watch the Redskins play!  Great crowd and bar staff, good beer and a great atmosphere during the game.

Highly recommended! #HTTR
author: Adam C.

description: Great place! They treat customers like family, attracts friendly customers and had free hot dogs!!! Such a fun experience.... We went in for one drink, loved it, stayed for 4 hours!
author: Maya A.

description: Came here with a large group of coworkers after an event on a weekday and they welcomed us with open arms. We pumped the jukebox with music, and when we wanted to turn the music up they accommodated us multiple times! A lot of places would've brushed us off, so it was great that they hustled to serve drinks quickly and let us have a good time!
author: Jessica N.

description: Friendly Staff, Friendly people (as long as you're not an asshole). These people don't bullshit. That's what I love about it!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
Passport required for non US ID holders. That's horse shit. We were promptly asked to leave because our friend didn't have a passport to show. I thought we were at a bar in SF, not a border crossing. 

I wasn't going to write a negative review about it, I get it, your bartenders are too retarded to decipher someone's age. But, what really sealed the deal on what ASSHOLES these guys are is this:

We were standing outside Red Door trying to figure out our next move when a family riding bikes comes along. A boy about 6 years old is in DESPERATE need of the restroom. His father takes him inside Red Jack to see if he can escort is son to the bathroom (only sign of life on this block) as its an emergency and was told NO! 

What kind of dirtbag bartender does that? Fuck these guys.
author: Cheeks L.

description: I really don't want to tell people how great this bar is because then it won't be hidden gem anymore! When I say I love this bar, I mean I LOVE THIS F****** BAR! Awesome staff and clientele! Total local hang out! Love you girls!
author: Tanya D.

description: I walked by this place on the way to Alcatraz tours. I met some guys on the Alcatraz boat who raved about this place. I wanted to watch the Warriors game and the guy raved about the Boston vibe. Not sure what that had to do with Warriors but I go to bar and got a prime spot at bar. The owner put out like a 100 free hot dogs. I ate 2. The service was awesome. The gal even let me charge my dead phone. Met some great people and the atmosphere was awesome. Some out of town Brit gals were fun and we all went out to another bar at North Beach after. Great times. Will be my must stop every time out.
author: Lee O.

description: Home away from home - staff is great, crowd is 110% Boston! It is the perfect spot to catch a Pat's game - get there early, this place gets packed.
author: Marie C.

description: Well I checked in too early we got rejected for a just expired CDL. Oh well they don't have food anyway...
author: Greg F.

description: My last review was removed.  I would have revised it after an apology.  I was lost in San Francisco and needed to use a restroom.  I saw the bar and asked the guys standing outside if it was okay to use their restroom.  I was under the assumption that they were bouncers.  They said yeah come in it's cool.  After I exited the men's room and was considering buying a drink, the bartender started getting irate with me.  I explained to him that his bouncers had let me in but instead he continued getting rude saying that I needed his permission to use the bathroom etc...  But he kept on being disrespectful.  I was going to buy a soda or something but that experience left me quite upset.  Not the way to treat people, period!  Not a place I hold in high regard.
author: Richard D.

description:
Best pats bar in the city!!!!

Cheap beer, great TVs, great beer on tap, awesome drink specials.

They even have free food when the pats play.

My boyfriend and I love coming here and don't see ourselves watching the game anywhere else anytime soon.
author: Madison F.

description:
A true dive bar. 

I happened upon this place as I was wondering around. I stopped in for a few beers. The bartenders were very nice and friendly. The bar itself was kind of cool too. 

The "Dive" part is the clientele. Not a group I'd want to hang with. I was there in the late afternoon on a Friday, so probably just as happy hour crowds started to assemble. Maybe it got a little better later in the night. Probably a good spot to watch a game on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon though.
author: Nick D.

description:
Dive bar!!

But in the realm of dive bars, it gets 4 stars because the drinks are super cheap (6 dollar mixed liquor drinks) and the crowd is friendly. There's a cool dart board and some TVs.
author: Kim P.

description: A homey little neighborhood bar.  I used to live near this place, have walked past it a million times, but never went until I came back to SF to visit.  Came here with six friends for drinks.  They have a great (modern) jukebox in the back (where you can blow a ton of money spending 50 cents to $1 per song).  They also have a great dart board.  Bartender was very friendly and the people there are an older crowd that I'm guessing live in the neighborhood.  I was too drunk by the time I got here so I didn't get anything with alcohol... but a diet coke will you run you $2.   Two bathrooms in the back and some TVs around.  It's a little too grungy in here for me, but it was conveniently close to my friend's place.
author: Christine L.

description: What a great, friendly place..... Washington Redskins fans, and any Boston team..... this place is MUST..... STAFF is awesome .... AND the FREE PROCESSED hot dogs on game day were the best I have ever had!!!! We will be back!
author: Steve H.

description: To make a long story short, it shouldn't take approximately 5 minutes for the bartender to serve a draft beer. I'd rather take the extra 10 minute walk to North Beach for the better bars on Grant Street.
author: Gerry L.

description: This place is disgusting. You can smell the mold before you even walk in the door. The patrons are drunk upon arrival and many are either tourists or the workers from the Pier 39 tourist traps. The bar allows its patrons to loiter outside causing a loud ruckus in the street. They don't card, so many patrons seem to be rather young. I have both been in this place (something I will never do again) and I live just down the block. I have had to call Red Jacks many times and ask them to please quiet their outside patrons from the hours of 11:30pm to 2am on weeknight ls and weekends. They are always nice about it over the phone, but they never actually do anything about it. I've had to walk over there in my pajamas and tell them to be quiet at 1am on week nights after the loud drunks woke me from a sound sleep. And again, I have to mention the stench. When I walk by it on my way home from work every week night, I can smell the sour rancid fumes from 10 feet away. They desperately need a bouncer and some bleach.
author: Kendell H.

description:
Terrible experience! My husband and I went to Red Jack Saloon on Sunday afternoon to watch a football game. This place has a policy that it only accepts US ID or passport only. I recently moved from Canada (and don't carry a passport on me at all times, but I look much older than 21). The bouncer explained the policy as we pleaded with him to just allow an exception using my Canadian DL. He wasn't too rude. 

Standing next to me was a man eavesdropping. All of a sudden he gets very close to my face and says he's the owner and it's his policy and he doesn't care if I come in or not. He started behaving like a crazy person.  When I advised him that his attitude was appalling for the owner of the business, he said he didn't care what I thought. After he continued to to tell me he didn't want my Canadian business, I said I would review his behavior and business he said, "oh what on Yelp? Oh I'm scared! I don't give a sh@t if you review me".  While I understand the policy, the owner's behavior was truly terrible.  I hope this post will make him reconsider this disregard for sites such as this.
author: Karina S.

description:
If you're looking for a Boston bar with a Redskins problem, Red Jack is the perfect place. With TVs all around and a sizable crowd of DC fans, I'm eternally grateful for a crowd to sing Hail to the Redskins with on those Sundays I sneak into the city. While some seasons aren't as amazing as this one-- all hail RGIII--I can always count on Red Jack to make me feel like I'm back in ol' DC for a few hours. 

Unlike Dan Snyder, Red Jack doesn't seem to abuse fan's pocketbooks. Drinks are cheap and there's a drink special every day of the week. I don't think I've ever landed here except for Sunday. Something about the Bloody Mary's at this place... they're quite good. Maybe even better than Starboard and that's a toughie. Thick, hearty and just enough to be the perfect hair of the dog. 

Make sure to check out the back patio. It's a nice nod to Fenway.
author: Anne Marie M.

description: If your in town looking for a local, down to earth corner bar....this is the place. Good conversation , cheap drinks overall great atmosphere. Recommend
author: Mark W.

description: I like the beers and the staff is friendly but the venue is small
author: Ryan R.

description: Small but I love the local feel. Bartenders are awesome and what makes this place a great spot. Really good price for drinks. If you are just looking for somewhere to relax and grab a drink or two and nothing too crazy this place is highly recommended
author: Josh K.

description:
Great place, great people!  Great if you're a Redskins fan!

Tip:  They open at 9:30am on Sundays.  And while they don't have a kitchen, they always bring in some sort of food to share.  It's a really great place with great owners and no ego.  Enjoy!
author: Mark B.

description: This place is racist as fuck. Bar full of white ppl, and 3 Asian walk in, and he can't serve us just because my friend's ID was just a little bented. It's 1am in the morning. Who give a shit. It's 2000 fucking 14, get wit it.
author: Kai L.

description:
Great place, great people and a great afternoon spent playing darts and bullying the jukebox.

I stumbled across this place with my boyfriend after a chilly trip to Alcatraz. We stopped in for one drink to warm us up and ended up staying all afternoon and into early evening. The owner and bartender were incredibly friendly and the regulars were also really welcoming.

Try the hot buttered rum!

I will absolutely be going back here next time I'm in the area.
author: Manda C.

description:
In style.

Not so much: Ugly Christmas Sweaters. Quintessential party theme.

Definitely: Only $8 for a cocktail and draft beer.

Unpretentious and relaxed. Wear whatever sweater makes you happy. Let the cheap drinks take care of the rest.
author: Jason B.

description:
Amazing $6 Bloody Mary on Sunday! Variety of games, small outdoor patio. They had a "skinny colada" which was great. Piña colada vodka, soda water and a splash of pineapple juice. 

The bartender Shauna was super nice.
author: Adele A.

description:
102 - 89

No big thing, that's just the final score in game 1 of the NBA Finals featuring the Lakers and those crummy Celtics that I just had the pleasure of watching at Red Jack Saloon.

Sooooo, when some co-workers of mine broached the subject of watching Kobe Bryant whoop dat ass in North Beach this evening, the idea of checking out the action at Red Jack was born. Little did I know, though, that this spot was a well-known Boston bar! Arrrrrrgh! Had I known that, I'd have opted to listen to the game with a strung out trucker named Gil over a CB Radio along the dusty roads of Barstow. But hey... I was already there with some good company (meaning the people I came with), so I really had no other option but to stick it out.

The bar itself wasn't all that bad, but if you're not a fan of Boston sports, you might be pretty annoyed. I guess you have to give credit to those jerks for having relatively good sports teams and being passionate about their city... so I can't knock 'em too hard... but seriously, do you have to be sooooo obnoxious? I mean, they were cursing at The Joker fer Christ sake! There's no reason to bad mouth Jack Nickelson just because he's sitting court side at the Staples Center, right? What about Chris Rock and David Spade?!?! Anyhoo, I digress....

The bar has some pretty decent drink specials, which made up for the rowdy, potty mouthed fans. Though not reinventing the wheel by any means, tonight was "Thirsty Thursday," which meant we were privy to $3.50 well cocktails for the entire evening. They have a chalk board with the rest of the week's bargains, but I was too busy being sprayed with saliva by a rotund gentleman with a thick accent and a faux-vintage green Celtics shirt from Urban Outfitters to soak it all in. But even though I wasn't able to take notes, I'm willing to bet the incentives would leave me with no option but to return at a later date. 

They threw in some free hot dogs for the entire bar, so that was a pretty nice treat (if you like manufactured meat byproducts, that is) so even if you're a sports fan in the minority, you have to respect the generosity. If you despise Boston sports, however, you may want to wait until all of their teams have the day off. Just sayin'.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I stopped in here with a friend who used to work nearby.  It's one of those "where everybody knows you name" kind of bars and my friend had memories of fun times insider.  I can see an afterwork crown gathering here but we arrived a bit earlier and there were some locals that seemed very much at home.

No one knew who we were and it took a while to get anyone's attention, but the beer was cold and that's all I needed.  We hung out for a while and then left because we had dinner reservations down the street.

I doubt if I'll ever set foot inside the place again.  There was nothing wrong with it, but I'm a tourist when I'm in SF and I like to explore new places.
author: Don W.

description: Awesome hole in the wall joint! We were looking for a non-touristy place, and we found it. Great atmosphere, fun people.
author: Sarah T.

description: Such a great experience! Our waiter Samir was awesome and the food was great too. No complains, only smiles! Thanks Samir!!!!
author: Connie X.

description: Had too much fun here. Don't go if you if you don't like fun. Friendly local joint off the beaten path. It's a nice escape from the chaos of the wharf.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Fun, non touristy local bar very near pier 39. Reasonably priced drinks. Comfortable environment and friendly bartender.
author: Greg L.

description: not a red sox fan,not a bruins fan, still like this place. it's the consummate sports bar (boisterous patrons, fun bartenders, good quick drinks). they are cool with bringing in a pizza (ask first though) and the door guys are really awesome.
author: Mike V.

description: We had a nice time here after doing the tourist thing and deciding to escape Fisherman's Wharf.  The bartender was very accommodating, changing TVs as requested and lending us a phone charger.  It's a regular, no frills bar, but I wouldn't go as far as calling it a dive.
author: Mike T.

description: Neighborhood bar? Tourist bar? Boston bar? No one is quite sure, even when we could stand there during the 7 minute wait for three High Lifes the answer just wasn't there. These days being a "Boston bar" is nearly as common as being a SF bar. I'd likely love this bar if I lived within two blocks of it, but beyond that I wouldn't seek it out. Harsh tones, yes. However, they do complete the age old trinity of being a bar: 1. There's a bar. 2. There's a guy with booze that stands behind it. 3. There's space where you can stand in front of it with the booze you obtain from said guy. Ta da! After that, nothing else really matters. When you're wandering around after realizing that Beer 39 is a souvenir store and not the dingy dive hidden gem amidst Pier 39 that you wished, drink the memories of that albatross away at The Red Jack Saloon.
author: Jon A.

description:
Who the eff takes a Yankees fan (sporting a Yankees cap) to a Red Sox bar?! (that would be me, guilty)

In my defense, it was a random afternoon, we needed a break from wandering the city all day, AND it was a Giants game on; neither the Red Sox or the Yankees were playing. The bartender welcomed us warmly, and there was no hate on the Yankees fan that I dragged in. 

Great prices on drinks, laid back patrons, and a nice dartboard in the corner.
author: Ting S.

description: Redskins bar that opens early for Sunday 10am games. Doesn't serve food but you can get food from other locations and bring in to eat and watch the game.
author: Amber O.

description: Way better than anything on the wharf,save yourself from the tourist trap and take the 5 minute walk over here. Bloody Mary specials on the weekend too!
author: Aaron F.

description: This bar seemed sad inside on a Saturday night and the drinks were dismal. They had outdoor seating and smoking listed on their yelp info and the party I was with was told they couldn't smoke, because it was a residential area where other apartments were near?! My friend found it annoying that they listed Themselves as smoking allowed but didn't have it.
author: Amanda Q.

description:
Had a choice of either this place or buena vista as the neighborhood go to when i  lived in the area.  Love irish coffees but didn't want to exactly chat up folks from cleveland or england after work.

Miss the homage to the green monster they had on the wall in the back patio.  With that said, had a funny laugh when one of the locals told me of a story between Bob Kraft and Laurie.  

Kraft and his cronies cruising up/down bay looking for danko when the patsies were in town to play da raiders.  He sees his team flag along w/BoSox fly outside the bar so comes to say hello.  Starts pointing at the flag saying 'hey im the owner'  Laurie fires back 'f you i'm the ownah'  Kraft then replies 'no no I own the NE Patriots' and apparently left a few tickets behind.  

Good neighborhood bar if your in the area or nice getaway from 39 for cheaper drinks and the sounds of remdog and orsillo on NESN if your into it
author: Clark G.

description:
Bookmarked this place for years from walking by one day while out with a group of friends.  Something about a bar in the middle of nowhere just has charm in my opinion.  

The place is not as small as I thought but it's charming nonetheless.  Besides the seats at the bar, there are some tables around or you can be like me, hog the damn Ms. Pac Man game table!  There is a very big jukebox, a dart board and an ATM as well as the two unisex restrooms up a few steps.

There are daily specials.  Yesterday (Thursday), it was $3.75 well drinks - all day, can't beat that!  Another plus - they have chips at $1 bag!  Lots of selection too - pretzels, Lays, corn chips, Funyuns, pork rinds - every bar should sell salty munchies like this to go with the drinks!

Obviously being in SF, they have the Niners and Giants around but they are true fans Patriots.  If you are a Patriot fan, I would definitely recommend coming here for the game and root among other fans.
author: Gloria H.

description: Seemed like a pretty cool bar.  Too bad we couldn't enjoy it.  They wouldn't accept my friend's temporary DMV issued license, even though he had the expired pictured ID to go with the temporary paperwork.  It's their policy so I guess I can't fault the bar too much.
author: Kim T.

description:
Definitely a dive bar.  Happy hour available (yay!), friendly bartenders and owners, and decently priced drinks.  Good after work spot with sports always on the boob tube, a jukebox (i think?), a diverse selection of liquor, and again - awesome bartenders.

Only thing is it does get crowded and it reeeeeeeeeeks of yack in the back by the bathrooms.  Man, someone must have yacked a while ago on the carpet.  Could you guys clean that by chance?  Other than that, all thumbs up.  Kudos to you!!
author: Dee H.

description:
Was back in this bar the other night and realized after leaving that my 2 star review contained one too many stars.  

This place sucks.  And the owner has the biggest mouth I've ever heard on a human being.  Dude, we can hear you and your retarded Chowda accent!!  Now STFU please.

Orig Post:

So so dive bar that's falling apart & filled with people from Massachusetts who get belligerent during all pro boston games.  It' not completely without it's charms though:  as there's a darker skinned inattentive & seemingly stoned female bartender here that outgrew her jeans about 3 years ago.
author: Kyle K.

description:
If you are a Boston fan then this is the place for you!

We came here last Sunday (4/22/12) on a friend's recommendation (new friends, yay!) after spending a nice sunny afternoon walking the Wharf.

The place bleeds Green (Celtics) and red (Sox) and gold & black (Bruins).

The drinks are cheap and strong and the bartender was nice and attentive... granted it was a quiet Sunday afternoon. The bar was fully stocked and had drink specials.

There are plenty of tv's, games like darts you can play and the crowd looks like a mix of locals, workers from the area, and tourists. Overall it seems homey and a fun place to watch a game (I happen to bleed Green :)

The restrooms did NOT smell like yak (as stated by previous reviewers) but the carpet in the front area DEFINITELY did! Or something in there did. You know that musty, wet bar floor, 1,000 year old carpet smell? Well its there. And its not nice. But if you can get past that everything is else is cool about this place.

I'll be back definitely... especially with playoffs around the corner!
author: Yahra V.

description:
You know how sometimes you just crave a drink?  I was in the neighborhood on what was probably the only warm day we have had in the last, oh, YEAR or so & thought it would be good to grab a margarita since it was Cinco De Mayo.  Except, oops, the door was locked when I got there.  Damn, I just became THAT guy who is first in line at the bar - it was 10 minutes before opening (1pm).  

Having poured more than a few drinks behind a bar in my day, I know how annoying the early bird patrons can be.  Shawna wasn't annoyed one bit, though, and opened up the place early.  For ME.  I felt so special.  

The Red Jack Saloon isn't a pretentious bar like many of them can be in San Francisco (not that I mind that scene sometimes also).  But if you are in the mood to go to a cozy place in a good neighborhood - this place is the spot.  There's a back patio with some tables beyond the bar...they say they don't allow smoking there, though, I'm pretty sure one of the bartenders was smoking when I was there.  Yeah, another one of those "non-smoking" patios - I happen to know a lot of those.

I will have to cruise back this way and see how good they can make a Martini - after 1pm, though, of...course!
author: Christian H.

description: Dive bar to the extreme. Local SF bar for Redskins fan, which was really nice! The owner is a bit gruff but it was no biggie for us when we were there to watch the Monday night game. There were 2 mice (very tiny) when we were there. They didn't bother anyone, but it should be noted. The front door and the back door were open and it was cold outside, so perhaps that was where they came from.
author: Nancy A.

description:
Nothing like a Boston bar in Frisco. Red Jack is super laid back and provides stiff, cheap drinks. Nice to find a casual bar within walking distance of our hotel on Fisherman's Wharf. 

They have daily specials, so make sure to check out the board by the bar.
author: Kat M.

description: My friend and I were feeling spontaneous and left from out southern california town to san francisco and had no clue what we were getting ourselves into once we got to san francisco at 9pm we parked and walked to the closest bar here and this happend to be it the place is decked out in boston stuff I dont mind though the atmosphere in this place makes up for it the people seemed friendly and welcoming
author: Justin H.

description: Accidentally stumbled in here while in the city. EXCELLENT place. Melissa the bartender is awesome.  It's a New England bar but has a huge Washington Redskins following.  However all fans are welcome. 6 TV'S with season ticket. Great drink specials and free hotdogs.  Will definitely be back.
author: Jen G.

description:
If I could only take stars away from reviews I would knock them down from a 4 to a -3, 

Went out with my coworkers after we had all gotten off. We work in the area so we started off at Kennedy's for happy hour then moved here for stronger drinks. This is the dive bar that dive bars workers go to on their night off. The bartender was rude, aggressive and extremely gruff, the place is small and empty but with an odd issues of not having enough tables and chairs for the amount of people they get. 
Their "credit card machine was down" all night, but lucky for us, there was an ATM tucked in the back with a lovely $3.50 charge. There's no music playing unless you pay for it at the juke box in the back, but even then there's nothing but the speakers it came with.

Suddenly $10 cocktails at a place that takes cards, plays musics, has enough room for me and my party and has staff that's polite isn't so bad since I ended paying around the same amount anyway.
author: Brian J.

description: We were looking for a place to watch the Thursday night football game. Great neighborhood bar, cold beer, friendly atmosphere,good prices.
author: Lynn K.

description:
Stumbled on this place by accident and am glad I did. The bartender Mark was an absolute legend and really welcoming. He made the place. We only stopped in for one pint and stayed most of the night.

When I'm back in town I'll definitely be heading back here.
author: Jamie G.

description:
Coooooooool place.

This was stop 3 or maybe 4 on Tom's adventure and explore night. I was a few beers in with a few shots on top but I remembered enough of this spot to make a little Yelp review. 

I like the feel, it was cool and had a nice 'corner bar' feel. The music was the jukebox which was a nice change of pace. 

They had drink specials and good beer available so all the boys were happy. I think I was drinking beer here. I recollect decent service plus they had darts! Wheeee!
author: Nick B.

description: My brother-in-law says, "greatest place ever, wonderful toshiba televisions, and it's wonderful that the Reds beat the Cardinals today!" After slamming 4 beers he advises 5 stars but my mother-in-law says that the diet coke tastes like regular so consequently only 4 stars.  Decent selection of beers, good atmosphere, and friendly locals.
author: Christopher W.

description: What a great place!!! Mark & Laurie treated us like family! Nicole is super friendly. We'll definitely be back!
author: Lisa H.

description: Awesome dive. We drank with the bartenders' husband, and she (the bartender, wish I had gotten her name) bought us our second round of drinks. Everyone was really friendly, no one treated me like a tourist (I'm from San Diego). The only downside was that there wasn't enough seating. Great place overall!
author: Letitia S.

description: Cool bartender, nice locals, good drinks that won't rape your wallet.  What's not to love?
author: G 8.

description:
Attention bostonians, red sox fans or whoever.... red sox-dive bar alert right here in SF! 

If you ever wondered where all those really cool and relatively unknown dive bars are hiding.... Well I just discovered one the other night. The selfish part of me was reluctant to write this review for fear of letting the secret out..... but since I love you yelpers so much I decided to share. 

because sharing is caring. and i care.  

Ok I lied... a little. I didn't exactly find the Red Jack Saloon myself.... a friend is in town right now visiting from boston and he actually found it. after pre-drinks at michelle's we headed out to fishermans wharf to watch the Sox game. The first thing I said when I walked inside was, "huh? No f'ing WAY is a bar this perfect in fishermans wharf!"  

Its certainly not my usual cup of tea..... but i knew i had stumbled upon something really good. Its very low key and you can almost feel the history pouring out of the walls. 

The best feature to me was nice local vibe. Everyone we met knew each other already.... And when we walked in, we instantly became a part of their family. We were there on Wednesday which they call "Whatever Wednesday".... Meaning whatever drink the bartender chooses that night (he gave us 3 options) is $3.50 

yes $3.50-- all night long. way CHEAP! I picked the rum. naturally.

They also have darts.... Or as my boston friend called it "daahts".  

Then, there's a jukebox-- YAY! And just when you thought it couldn't get any better.... They have a great little outdoor patio are in back for smokers. The entire back wall is painted like the Green Monster so you feel like you're sitting in Fenway Park.

And speaking of cool...... one of the regulars here is a former inmate of Alcatraz. Yes, its true. His name is Darwin Coon and he was an inmate there from 1959 to 1963. yes i asked, he was in for bank robbery. We were trying to get him to tell us some good prison stories but the Sox game was on and we had our priorites...... anyway, he was a nice old guy and when he left I actually gave him a big hug. See what a little rum will do? Here's a great story about him: http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/chronicle/archive/2000/08/14/MN88235.DTL

Really, how much more do you need? Red Jack Saloon has "daahts", a jukebox, red sox fans, a smoking patio with the green monster, cheap drinks, Alcatraz inmates and a lot of history..... i for one  will be back. in fact, its been awhile since i've done this but....yes i think a little Yelp outing here might be in order. stay tuned
author: Michelle I.

description:
The best place to watch the Washington Redskins this, and any season. We aim to be the largest and best 'Skins bar in SF by the end of the year. Please come out and see for yourself. We took this bar by storm last year and the owners could not have been any more pleased. They are by far the friendliest and most welcoming bar owners I have met in SF.

Go Skins! See you on Sunday for the Hall of Fame game against Indy. Kickoff is at 5PM PST.
author: neil c.

description: Good cheap bar, plenty of drinks options, jukebox, darts and plenty of screen showing various sports channels. Off the main fishermans wharf area, but worth the trip.
author: Tom S.

description:
After a brief stay at a party at the aquarium that we-thought-was-open-bar-but-disappointedly-wasn't, we needed a drink and fast! My bf remembered stumbling by a bar on Bay Street a while ago and led the way to where he thought the bar was. Luckily, he was pretty accurate and we arrived at the Red Jack Saloon!

The bar was filled with festive, fun Halloween decorations and lots of Red Sox and Patriots paraphernalia (a Boston fan we were with and I were excited!). The drink special of the night was $3 Red Stripe beers. So for 4 pints of beer, one vodka-pineapple, and one cosmo, the total was only $21. I love cheap drinks!!! They also have great drink specials every night- margarita Monday's, rum cocktail Tuesdays, and so on...

We found a table and so many fun games. Immediately, we started in on our own Connect Four tournament then Jenga then darts. Fun! 

The bar was not too packed but definitely had its fans. Also, the girls' bathroom was kind of interesting in a fun way (but you'll have to see for yourself what I mean...). I was so energized after a fun night at the Red Jack Saloon that I raced the mile home, uphill, in heels since we couldn't find a cab... I'll be back!
author: Meghan P.

description: Been going here once a week since I moved into the near neighborhood 4 years ago. Still have not received friendly service, with the exception of the curly haired lady ;). Crazy I would rather spend money at Hillstone where they all know my name and know where I'm from.
author: blue r.

description:
This is an awesome sport bar in the best American style.
There are 4 (or 5) TVs there, and all bartenders are great!
I was very pleased to meet Lori, the owner, who was a very kind person!
I truly recommend this bar for hang out with friends on any day in the week.
I'm marking this as a 4-star because I really think would be awesome to have some live music there, but even they have a really REALLY good jukebox there!
I really appreciated all time I spent there!
Recommended!
author: Lucas M.

description:
This is a cool little dive bar within a neighborhood haha. Kind of a weird location if you ask me. Anyways, they have a menu called ''cheap bastards'' with shots for only $2! They're not the strongest shots but it works. They have different specials every day of the week which is pretty cool.   They also have a back patio which would have been cool to hang out at but it was cold that night so maybe next time. The bartender was pretty cool too. He hooked it up with pineapple juice. 

Also, wild things happen here. As I was waiting for the ladies room, a guy walks out, smirking and closes the door behind him. I thought to myself, what if he went number two...I'll just wait a little bit...THEN, a chick walks out after him!! Figure it out.
author: Anna G.

description:
The best place in town to watch a Boston game! Atmosphere was great and Mark, the bartender, was too sweet. We were there before, during and after a Bruins playoff game, so at the end of his shift he gave us each a token for a free drink! Much appreciated.

Plus, they have super cheap drink specials every day of the week and good draft beers were under $6 for a pint.

Will definitely be back here whenever I'm homesick. Boston, you're my home, and Red Jack Saloon... well, you're the best I can do in SF.
author: christine c.

description: Non-tourist no frills solid bar right next to SF tourist mecca (fisherman's wharf).  If you want a good beer away from all the tourist ***t then this is your place.  $10 minimum.
author: Caleb R.

description: The ladies who work here are awesome! Free Fenway franks during the World Series!  Good sox crowd all around! Thanks ladies!
author: Beth H.

description: We were driving through town from Portland and wanted to do a couple SF tourist things and watch game 6 of the NBA finals. We parked about a half block away and were going to walk to the Pier 39 before returning to the bar to watch the game.  We asked the mechanic next door to Red Jack's Saloon if he thought our car would be safe with a few things visible inside and paddle boards on top.  He said it wouldn't (it wouldn't be in Portland either) but he would move a car he had parked in front of the bar so we could park there... this was the first awesome thing we experienced on this evening.  We parked in front of the bar and asked an employee that was out front if he thought the car would be safe there.  He said it would and that he was the doorman and would watch it for us regardless.  Awesome thing number two.  We went to the pier with our dog and returned for the game.  We were about to put the dog in the car and the doorman told us we could bring her in.  WTF?  Bring a dog into a bar?  This doesn't happen in Portland.  So we brought the dog in and not only did a woman who seemed to be a manager (?) get us a tray table and chairs to sit at because the place was packed for the game, they brought the dog treats and water.  Awesome things numbers three and four.  The staff and the clientele alike were all super friendly... like to the point that we wondered if we were on some type of hidden camera show.  Awesome#five.  We are dive bar regulars in Portland, but have never experienced this much warmth outside of places we've been patronizing for years.  Red Jack's is THE BEST!
author: Patrick D.

description:
This is my new favorite after work bar. It has lots of things I like. A nice bartender, a jukebox with booty-shakin music, darts, connect four, a patio, longboard lager, uno with dogs on the cards, and a former convict from Alcatraz.
hearts red jack.
author: Nikki M.

description: Probably the most un-hipster bar I've been to in SF (not including the Marina district). Biker boys galore. And, I'm not talking fixie boys... I'm talking "behind bars" real biker boys.. uh-hem, men. Wha? This is a Boston Red Sox bar? Really? Well, okay I guess. There are lots of pennants and B sox stickers adorning the place, but there are also some SF Giants love and a nice nod to US military service, here.  And, I have to give much love to the bartendress! She understood that I wasn't drinking and was in desperate need of a sugar free energy drink. I'd go back just to chat with her. Plus, the laid back atmosphere didn't hurt either... bunch of Red Sox peeps watching and rooting for the SF Giants - what's not to like?
author: Kara B.

description:
If you find yourself in the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco and in need of a cold adult beverage, there is no need to pay tourist-trap prices. Just hit the Red Jack and you'll be pleasantly surprised (and well taken care of).

We made the mistake of going to a bar on Pier 39 for a beer on Saturday night, just because there weren't many other options we were aware of. After paying over $10 for two Coronas (!!!), I got on my iPhone and looked on Yelp for other options. Turns out The Red Jack was only about three blocks north of the pier and thankfully outside the touristy area. 

The Red Jack has great "curb appeal," as it's located on the ground floor of an old apartment building. Inside, it has lots and lots of charm. We sat right at the bar and were very happy to learn that the beer special of the day was Widmer Hefewiesen draft for $3 a glass!  Being from Portland, where Widmer is brewed, (and which also happens to be one of our favorites) this was indeed a nice surprise. 

The bartender was a very nice young woman who took good care of us. She was friendly and engaged us in conversation throughout the night. The bar has a dartboard, pinball machine, a great Internet enabled jukebox (so you can request just about any song), and a bunch of board games you can take up to the bar (which we did).

Another nice surprise was the OTHER drink special of the night, which was the house Bloody Mary for $4.25. I'm not a big bloody mary drinker, but this one was really good and quite spicy. I may be hooked.

The bathrooms were small but clean. They have a nice outside patio with a wall painted to look like Fenway Park's "Green Monster." It was a bit too chilly to sit out there, but it was an appealing space.

Unfortunately, we found out last night that the Red Jack is in danger of closure due to complaints from neighbors about noise. What kind of jerk moves to a neighborhood with a long-established bar like this one then is surprised that there's "noise." Idiots. Anyway, hopefully the RJ's loyal local clientele can save the place. It's a gem.
author: Jamie F.

description:
RJs is the friendliest bar you can imagine. Laurie, Mark and Nicole(and the other bartenders, I'm sure) make you feel so at home, and your first visit here will certainly not be your last!

Plus, they have complimentary hot dogs/meatballs for Sunday football :o)
author: Geir R.

description:
The Red Jack Saloon is exactly what one might expect it to be: dive-y, loud, and completely free of pretentiousness. Oh, and yes, it's definitely a sports bar. I came here with a group of four on a Friday night around 9:30, and we were able to find seating at a table; most people seemed to prefer standing at or around the bar. The crowd was loud (think drunken thirty-something men), the bar tenders were friendly (they gave everyone cake because it was one of the bar tender's birthday), and the beer was cheap. 

The special drink of the day  runs around $3, but other drinks are priced pretty normally (about $7 for a mixed drink). There is one dart board, three or four big screen TVs, and that about sums it up.

I know other people are yelping that this is a "hidden gem," but, honestly, I don't see the hoopla. There's nothing wrong with the place, but it's not really memorable, either.
author: Sonia M.

description: I come here everyday after work and I love it. Lori and Mark are amazing, and so is all of their bar staff (Shawna, Nicole, Nick, Chad). She'll even throw on the Padres game for me when seasons in!!  Seriously, what's not to love about the Red Jacks!!
author: Jeremy H.

description: Nice little local bar in what seems to be a quiet area, although the Embarcadero is just two streets down. The bartender was a lot of fun and the atmosphere over all was very relaxed.
author: F O.

description: Love this place. Feels like home. Everyone from patrons to the bartenders and owners are the greatest people. Recently a patron and an employee (separately) passed away. This bar went into full mode to celebrate them and honor them. Very touching, not a dry eye at either memorial. They have fun drinks that are discounted based on the night and is a great place to watch a game..
author: Traci H.

description: Nicole is the friendliest bartender we know. She welcomed us to the neighborhood and made my drinks just the way I liked it. The drink prices can't be beat and the whole bar is clean. I like the fact that there's a dart board in the back and you can watch sports while hanging at the bar. This is my new favorite bar in North Beach.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: Darts, board games, cheap strong drinks, good jukebox, and pinball! What else could you want? Although be forewarned: if you come with competitive friends and are competitive (like me), you will end up playing endless games of Connect 4 to assert your dominance. You will then proceed to drink more, making it even harder to win. It's a vicious, drunken cycle.
author: Alissa M.

description: First and for most this is a Boston Bar, with that being said the bartenders are cool, they pour a good drink, and margarita Monday is the day to hang out. The tv's  usually have some type of game on and sometimes they offer hot dogs. Is this the best bar in the city no, but if I am in the area i will stop by.
author: Raul R.

description:
Best Pat's bar in the city. Mark and Laurie- the owners are the best. Free donuts and hot dogs on Sundays. Mike the bartender is the man. If you are from Boston, you should be embarrassed if you don't go here on Sundays. Cheap drinks, $4 Bloodies on Sundays, decent selection of craft beers and blue collar beers alike. It is like watching the game at your buddies basement, only better. 
Only weird thing is that Redskins fans also congregate here, doesn't bother me though they keep to themselves and God love em' for still showing up every Sunday. 
Not enough good things to say about this place. 
Go there!
author: Rich S.

description:
In the spirit of true dive bars, this place has no "busy" night. One Tuesday it'll be slammed, the next it'll be empty.

Strong drinks, great Jukebox, full of regulars.
author: Lauren F.

description:
My search is over.  A Redskins bar in San Francisco.  

I went for the first time for the first game of the season.  I was warmly greeted by fellow fans when I walked through the door and was happy. The owners were really welcoming and the BBQ was awesome.

I look forward to my football Sundays!
author: Dottie G.

description: Want a cheap, fun bar near the wharf? This is the place! relaxing, funky and one block  from the water. Worth the trek to get away for a drink that won't break the bank. Cool bartenders, too
author: Kelly L.

description: love laurie, mark nd shauna.  Fantastic people and great bar!  GO PATS!
author: Florence l.

description: Drove in to sf this morning from riverside and went right to work. Got off and have had bad service after bad service! Drinks are strong and delish! She improved the trip considerably! Will be back next time I'm in sf!
author: Miller S.

description: They didnt let us in the bar because we didnt have our passports. First time I see this kind of restriction, I showed my drivers license but didnt help. Such an idiot restriction.
author: Felipe L.

description:
Cheap drinks
Lots of TV
Lots of Boston Red Sox memorabilia
Jenga and Connect Four
Darts
Juke Box
Shot specails
Chill crowd

will be back next time in SF
author: Rick J.

description: My friends told me about this bar so I met them, the bartender had people laughing and it seam that the customer were having fun. The drinks were great and the big screen were great. We had a real good time I will be back soon.
author: Donna J.

description: So the Experience of visiting this bar was under weird circumstances SO I give it to the hosts and security  when a fought broke out  and they still made everyone fell safe.
author: Esther G.

description:
Hands down my favorite bar in North Beach SF! 

I felt like I never had a true lime margarita or bloody mary til I had one here. The margarita mix they use definitely taste homemade, not that sugary-fructose sweetness you often taste. They are very generous on the alcohol in their drinks, was feeling it already after one margarita! And the female bartender really lays it down good on those Jameson pours! But its the margaritas & bloody marys that really keep me coming back; I get cravings for them. Also the drinks here won't go hard on your wallet (Daily Specials, see images for the weekly calendar). 

Its a chill yet lively place with alot of conversation going on; dont come here to get your grind on. It's more of a place to take drinks to the face without having to yell over the music to talk to your friends. Bartenders are awesome and friendly; I only came in once and they remembered my face and name for the next times I came in so they didn't even card me.
author: Yodo S.

description:
A neighborhood place to get hammered, that much is certain. I was staying close by in North Beach so it was great to find this place for nightcaps and various mid day beers as well. They've got specials every day and the people are friendly. Guinness on tap and some decent micros, mixed drinks poured with a heavy hand as well. It's a really cozy place with the patio designed to look like the green monster, so I suppose it's a Boston joint too. Pinball, board games, and HDTVs are available for funz.

This is an awesome place to go if you're in the area and need a beverage break.
author: Charlie Y.

description:
I stop here every time I'm in the city. As a Red Sox fan I feel at home when I walk in here. Love the green monster on the back porch. 
I love neighborhood bars (not a club person) and this place is warm and friendly, even to those obnoxious Yankee fans that occasionally stumble in.
author: Barbara S.

description:
Great bar.  The drinks are stiff and the patrons and bar tenders are nice.  There is a dart board, and a pretty good juke box. 

Bonus star for being a half block from my apartment. :)
author: Theron L.

description:
Last Friday I got a call from from my friend Krista, who says "Ghetto, get your ass down here!"  I hail a cab and am happily on my way.  I was a little concerned, 'cause my friend sounded totally wasted and while I hate being "behind" in my drinking, I *love* having to catch up!  

This is a lovely little bar. Krista called out my full name as I entered, which made me feel very "Norm" from Cheers (except not hella fat, or male, or white).  I didn't pay too much attention to the decorations, but I remember it was dark and wood-y and they have a little back area with picnic tables,  and Buddha and Homer Simpson figures.  You can smoke back there.  Ghetto like-y.  

I will be back :D
author: Karen F.

description:
Yelp seems to be making some serious inroads in San Francisco. I've been recently asked by a bartender if it was me who wrote a very particular review about him. I've been asked if the Scavenger Hunt after-party was a Yelp-only event by some folks who wandered in off the street. And I've seen Yelp maps and ratings on a infotainment TV channel piped in at the The Red Jack Saloon.

So of course, that had to go into my Yelp review.

The Red Jack Saloon is a good neighborhood bar. I don't feel like I can recommend it as someplace you go out of your way for, so the extra star goes for being North Beach and keeping a local-friendly vibe. Also, I got carded. Wait, what? I'm in my 30s... thanks, Mr. Bartender! Unfortunately, I didn't get to meet Mark and Laurie, who I hear are "flippin cool".

Also, they serve my newly-discovered second-favorite porter, Deschutes Black Butte. Heh, I said "Butte".
author: Paul B.

description:
Are you a Redskins fan? Well you should be. This bar has the greatest group of Skins fans I've ever met in California.  Cheap drinks, free hotdogs, a section dedicated to the Redskins? I'm in heaven!

I'll be coming back again and again, but next time, I promise I'll remember to wear my jersey.
author: Sarah P.

description:
I used to live across the street from this place, so I started going for convenience alone. I grew attached.

Mark and Laurie, the owners, are so flippin cool. They have a knack for making you laugh....every 5 seconds....no matter how bad your day might have been. They tend to employ equally cool tenders for the days and nights they need some time off.

Its great to find a bar so close to tourist hell that has not yet been discovered by the tourists. You get one or two wandering in from time to time, but not often. This is definetely a neighborhood bar...with a good jukebox, good people (young and old), board games, darts, a back patio and an occasional bar-b-q. 

I still stop in even though it is no longer a convenient location for me, just cause I like the vibe.
author: Drue C.

description: Good place to come after work for happy hour, although it is a bit divey. Very good customer service.  Just make sure you are prepared for the $10 minimum credit card purchase and the no-so pleasant smell.
author: Maranda S.

description:
The other day I went on one my long pointless walks that go everywhere but nowhere in particular. After perusing tourist central (Pier 39), I wandered back passed the bus depot, looked left on Bay and saw Red Jack and mentioned that I had never set foot in there. Well, my traveling partner was inspired to do some extra exploring and in the mood for some liquid refreshment  (because it WAS 2 in the afternoon after all). So we put on our brave faces and got ready to set foot inside.

Ok, first off, "People Love Us On Yelp" sticker=good sign. Ashtray, out front; another good sign. Meet a former Alcatraz inmate and buy his book? Well now we're talking! The flat screen that features random Youtube clips AND Yelp reviews, darts and Red Sox paraphanilia all about, a chalkboard promoting (even more) affordable drinks--all good. 

 But when I see an establishment that has (a) an Old School standup Pac Man game, (b) the '94 World Cup pinball game (featuring the goalie, the dog and 75 cents gets you 5 balls!), (c) a covered outdoor smoking patio with about 300 ashtrays strewn and (d) sparkling, snappy commentary/ conversation with locals and the bartender, well then you get a place as comfy as my Yelp elite sweatshirt! Cheers!
author: Veronica G.

description:
It is all true. A hidden gem dive bar in San Francisco. Local, cheap and friendly. And in the unlikeliest of locations (1.5 blocks from my house) and far from anywhere that anyone not living in North Beach would ever travel to.

Once, I took a friend here for some 21st birthday pre-drinking. Within twenty minutes of her actually turning 21 (yes, 12:20 AM) the entire bar was buying her shots and by 1:00 AM she was out on the sidewalk throwing up. (Yes, it was supposed to be a pre-drinking destination but we never made it any farther). 

To this day I don't think she forgives me. 

(It probably doesn't help that sometimes when I'm walking by, I take a picture of the sidewalk where she was hurling with my camera phone and send her reminder pictures.)

Gotta love the Red Jack!
author: Derek B.

description:
This is a fun bar. We recently moved down the block from this place and we stumbled upon it on a walk from Safeway. We came in it was half way full and the Bartender welcomed us and we had a seat. We ordered some cocktails and we stated conversation with some of the locals that frequent the place. 

Everyone is friendly, Northeast fun attitude. Mark the bartender has a funny remark every couple words that will cracked you up.
