Some of the patrons are young and talk alot of smack that makes you laugh. I swear I thought I was at a place like cheers. Everyone knows each other and if you are new everyone introduces themselves. We met the Laurie, Mark's better half. She was very nice and accommodating. 

Thanks for the hospitality. One of our new places to hang out on a Fri after 5pm... 

Keep serving great spirits...
author: Alex V.

description:
BEST dive bar nearest to the Wharf BY far. Once I met some drunken crazy Irish guy here who's accent was so thick I thought he was speaking Celtic at times (maybe he was?). He was going on & on in a stupor it was hysterical.

Drunken tourist watching is great here! In & Out Burger is close by which give the extra star.
author: Chuck F.

description:
My watering whole in North Beach!

I loved just kicking back and enjoying my Jamesons and playing darts with my bro's. 

Truth S. says it right, for a bunch of Chowder Heads, Mark and co make us Yankee fans feel welcome. When I lived there, Mark and his wife were the best and really made you feel at home. I still have my Red Hook Stein!
author: Danny D.

description: This is a good spot for cheap beer.  I have happy hour there occasionally and sometimes stop in for that last over the top drink that puts me under.  It is very very close to where I live. Nick (the bartender)is awesome and and the crowd is fun.
author: Noneya B.

description:
i first moved to this neighborhood 2 years ago, saw the red jack and thought "pfff...sports bar".  

On a friend's recommendation and physical dragging into, i've learned that this is a true san francisco find.  How wonderful to have a neighborhood bar where you can find that your neighbor (that you've mistaken for a sweet old man) is really a lascivious lush who will hit on your husband in the least subtle way possible, where you can play some erotic photo hunt only to have an incredibly friendly transvestite jump over your shoulder with her fake nails to catch the extra bra strap you couldn't find on the screen before your time runs out...

the bartenders are friendly and fun and i find a new friend every time i end up here.  i remove one star for the hangover i will inevitably have the day after...but i'll put it back to give it five as i can always crawl right home...
author: lily z.

description:
I kinda hate to do this, but I gotta.  Sorry to make a point of you, Red Jack Saloon, but there's something you did that has gotten really old.  I went out with a group the other night and you denied one of our members service.  Why?  Because her drivers license has a crease in it from being in her pocket.  Now, I understand that underage drinking is against the law.  (I don't agree with it, but following the law is a good idea if you want your bar to stay open).  That is not an excuse, however, for paranoia.  We are not talking about someone who is anywhere near 21, by the way.  Not only that, you then proceeded to very visibly and embarrassingly kick her out of the bar, which of course motivated most of us to leave as well.  It was silly, it was handled poorly, and it was bad business.

Honestly, your bar was OK.  But definitely not so good that I won't miss it.
author: Adam H.

description:
Stoner Trivia!  A real dart board!  A mysterious backroom!  XMas decor the day after Thanksgiving!  This place is on it, man.  

I think someone said something before about a strange odor.  I am aromatically sensitive and I didn't detect anything out of place from any other dive pub.  

I couldn't help but wonder how many couples have gotten it on in the ladies' room- mirrors everywhere.  Strong and inexpensive drinks, a lot of board games.  This place was a comfortable departure from hipster nay-shun.   Heart it.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Red Jack Saloon is truly daytime drinking at it's finest.  And yes, a fine establishment for someone who loves the Red Sox (my friend) or someone who loves to hate the Red Sox (me).  I recommend going on Sunday to watch a game and staying into the evening with many rounds of beers and trivial pursuit, darts, pinball, or even the beer garden outback.  Seriously, this is ADD drinking heaven.  Of course it ain't much to look at, but, the people are friendly and if you hit it at the right time you may have the whole place to yourself.  

I wouldn't really go here to meet anyone unless you want to meet some diehard, beer drinkin', 70 year old, red sox fans.... 'Not that there's anything wrong with that'....
author: Katie M.

description: I heart Red Jacks. I've been coming here on and off for the past three years and I love how intimate it is. I can partake in conversation with my friends without it being a noise competition, there are a couple benches in the back for smokers, and the bartenders are AWESOME. I just get a simple Cape Cod, and after three, I'm the happiest girl at the jukebox singing Sublime songs. A huge plus for me is that they have CLEAN bathrooms. YAY!
author: Natasha P.

description: For my wife's birthday I called Red Jack and told them I'd be stopping by with 20 friends to start off the night before we went on a party bus.  The owner (can't remember her name) was so nice.  She put out balloons and had appetizers out for us when we got there.  I'm sure it wasn't all just for us, but she did accommodate our party nicely.  Red Jack is awesome!  I forgot to mention, they do a trivia game and we won t-shirts!
author: Robert S.

description:
I love this place, it's perfect for the casual friends last minute hang out.
We started Katie's good-bye drinking party here...what a night!
author: Jenn O.

description:
I've been to Red Jack a handful of times, and I have always had great experiences. I go to school across from Pier 39, so this is the closest bar to us... and who doesn't need the occasional drink after (or in between) classes? The place is cute, the bathrooms are clean, and the drinks are cheap, even on Friday nights! 

The most recent time I went was Friday night, and the bar wasn't very crowded. My friends and I had one whole part of the bar to ourselves. The bartender was nice and attentive, and my fiance and I ordered a beer, an Irish Carbomb, and a Scooby Snack for $20, including tip! I also discovered the matching game with naked men/women, which is just an awesome touch. This is definitely my favorite bar in the city!
author: Bridgette A.

description:
I am noticing a sad pattern here. First the Buena Vista gets a 5er and now the Red Jack Saloon gets a 5er. Both bars...Coincidence? I don't think so!

I LOVE YOU, MARK! And I really love you, Laurie, vivacious bride of said Mark. Both are from the New England area, I believe. Or maybe they just like the Red Sox. But if you like the Red Sox and live in San Francisco, then you must be from New England. Yeah, that makes sense. These two are the coolest vegetarian bar owners I know of. Well, the only vegetarians that I know of that own a bar.

I knew this place existed. Hell, I pass by here every so often. Just never went in for a drink. Until one night after work, a bunch of co-workers dragged me with them on their drinking adventures. I was game, thinking what can go wrong? I live in the North Beach area so I can stumble home no prob if I got sloshed. Funny thing is I was freaking buzzed that night. I remembered everything that happened. I know I went home to sleep for an hour because I had another shift in said hour. And I know I woke up late for work. The funny part is I actually clocked in on time...Anyone wanna try to explain that to me?

Anyways, the bar has a great atmosphere along with great bartenders. Nick and Nick are awesome. I know there are others but I always somehow end up with either Nick or Mark. The jukebox is internet ready so they have fresh music along with some moldy oldies that go great with too much drinking. And North Beach pizza knows where this place is in case you wanna go and order a pizza instead of walking a couple of blocks to Safeway to buy something cheaper. Oh, and if you ever have a need for a taxi, they have them memorized for you and will call them as well. Courtesy service at its best.

So Red Jack, you ROCK! Even though I am in the Sunset now, I will be back to conquer your bar in due time...Like after major surgery...Alcohol and surgery don't really mix well...
author: Anthony L.

description:
I spent a couple weeks in town for work, and they put me up in a Fisherman's Wharf hotel.  I spent the two weeks cursing tourists and trying to find a bar they hadn't taken over.  A few days before I left, I found this place, and I'm tempted to move out there just for this bar.

As every other reviewer has said, this place is incredibly laid-back and unpretentious.  I spent a few nights hanging out with the regulars and had a blast.  Everyone there was really friendly, the drinks were cheap, and OAR's live version of Crazy Game of Poker came on the jukebox every hour or two (it's like 11 minutes long - best value for your jukebox dollar, according the the guy that kept playing it).  They don't do food there, but they have a bunch of delivery menus at the bar so you can have food delivered there.  I even got to meet Darwin Coon, one of the last guys off Alcatraz when it closed, and bought a signed copy of his book right there.

Honestly, I feel a little guilty giving this place a good rating, because I don't want tourists to find out about it - I'll be back in SF again sooner or later, and I'll damn sure be going back to Red Jack.
author: Brock B.

description: Great dive for hanging out with my coworkers. Everybody seems to know one another, and even if you aren't local, everyone is super friendly. They have a different drink special every night... They have tons of board games to choose from, and someone is always playing the jukebox.. Darts, an old pinball machine, plenty of seating by the wall; what more could you ask for besides your beer?
author: Alyssa A.

description:
best place to drink by the pier, because f the hard rock and their $12 vodkas

Not many tourists, although i like seeing tourists. Some come in at times,... leaving them very open to be hit on! HEY NOW!!

Good stiff drinks, for a very reasonable (Cheap for SF) price. 

Last weekend they had The Oscars on one TV, and NBA Basketball on the other... all good!

try it!
author: angelo b.

description:
Mixed feelings for this bar makes me give it 3 stars. It's right around the corner from my place so its a good go to bar when I have a lot of friends over and we want to hit up a place that's not going to be super packed on a weekend.

However, the main bartender dude is very weird with drivers licenses. The first time I went my friend had just gotten his CA license and still had his old one - but it had a hole in it and he didn't bring his paperwork - ok understandable - its his fault for not bringing the temporary CA paperwork, so he was not let in.

The 2nd time I went in here - this happened AGAIN with another friend - but he had actually brought his CA papers - you know the ones the DMV tells you that you can carry around temporarily until your actual license came in as well as his old license. The bartender still would not let this guy order drinks - how ridiculous!

I'd still go back because its a fun bar - but too stressful for those kind of unnecessary confrontations.
author: Brittney E.

description:
R eally chill place on a Sunday night
E ven had free hot dogs!
D arwin Coon, ex-Alcatraz inmate, bought us 2 pitchers
    for being upstanding (and quiet) "young people"

J ust a relaxed neighborhood joint
A vailable parking on the street
C an play darts if that's your thing (though just 1 dart board)
K indly leave your blazers and popped collars in the Marina...
   kick back and chill!
author: Kenny L.

description:
Typical neighborhood bar, nothing special. Long tables are great for groups and parking is fairly painless on Bay Street. 

The place always smells like wet astroturf, not sure if that is an endorsement or a warning- but it definitely has its own odor.
author: Mike M.

description: How does this place not have five stars across the board!!! I would say some yankee fans reviewed it but we know they cant read and write. So i am not sure what the deal is.  I lived in Boston for 5 years and when I lived in NYC there were a handful of Boston sports bars that kept me from missing Boston too much.  I cant wait to watch the Red Sox, Celtics, Bruins, Revolution, cannons, wicked pats ... all the time. Look forward to going back again and again. For those of you that are not fans of wicked awesome Boston teams. They have nudie-touch you can play at the bar    ( megatouch).
author: douglas B.

description:
Good bar, was here on holiday and got sick of the glut of touristy type bars both pricewise and the lack of local culture.

Pretty loud although there were some big sporting events on while I was in. 

Owner and staff really friendly and polite, also with a good sense of humour. 

Good range of drinks and well worth a visit.
author: Ethan U.

description: Awesomely chill, local neighborhood bar-- also helps that its just around the block from me.  It does have 3 LCDs if you are trying to catch the game, updated jukebox if you are trying to listening to the latest Katy Perry song,  darts and small outdoor space in the back.  Bartenders are great.  Nicole is awesome.  There is NO kitchen, bags of chips may be available.
author: Alan P.

description: Before traveling out to my first trip to CA, I browsed the internet for any bars that may cater to Redskin fans.  Low and behold, The Red Jack Saloon appears.  After a few days in SF, I ventured out and finally found The Red Jack and loved the place.  Loved Nicole, the bartender that night.  Other patrons I met that night were very friendly...we talked sports, music, etc...I felt like I was a regular there....I've never felt like that here in the Northern Virginia area....would love to go back and stay longer.  Lastly, their jukebox contained some great rock music, Alice In Chains in particular!
author: Steve P.

description:
So after my horrible experience at Butterfly, we decided to trek towards N.beach for some hopefully better bloody mary experiences.  On our way down Bay, we noticed this bar in a unusual area of town - not much else around at all. 

We were there pretty early and there was only a couple older locals in the place.  Seemed like a nice local/sports bar.  I noticed ingredients to make a bloody mary on the bar, so I 'thought' I was in luck

******Bloody Mary Review*****
After I order a BM, the bartender grabs a quick pour filled with pre-mixed BM.  First sign things were not going well, since I knew he could have obviously made me one fresh.  He  sipped a small amount himself to make sure it tasted good.  Well I realized that after tasting mine, this guy didn't know what  a good bloody mary tasted like at all, since what I got was HORRIBLE!!!!  It not only didn't taste good, it actually tasted bad.  

So I will likely not go back. Any bartender should at least know what tastes awful and refuse to serve me something that tasted that horrible.  

It might be a good bar at night, it did seem like it had potential, but I most likely wouldn't recommend the need to travel to this area of town just to go.

Read some of my other Bloody Mary reviews at:
http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=YHu-iA23Xj2c1bVa7JROhA
author: Josh M.

description: This is a nice little local bar. The bartender was very friendly and the place had a comfortable atmosphere. I'll definitely be going back to drink a Guinness or three.  Growing up in NY I can't really appreciate the Boston'ness of the place but I can put all the Red Sox/Patriots stuff aside and enjoy myself.
author: Jamie G.

description: I love this place! Super friendly staff, decent alcohol selection and chill crowd -- what more could you ask for in a neighborhood bar?  :)
author: Lisa R.

description:
Oh man.  I'm embarrassed to have gone here so many times that they know my drink and know to include the lime.  A fun dive when your friends don't have to drive to get home.  Free dart board to challenge the dude at the board who thinks those fancy winged darts he bought are going to help.  I brought Dan, sucker.
But am I the only one who feels the weird vibe in this place?  Maybe when I go in without the necessary blinding intoxication, it feels different.
They have the digital jukebox that downloads the songs, so the selection in that thing is great, but its 2 credits per song and 2 credits cost a buck, so I played the new Wilco just a few days after it's released, but I paid a buck a song.  Which, well, after spending who knows what on drinks, why am I complaining about the convenience of the tunage?
Oh, Red Jack.
author: Kev M.

description: 4 stars for being the only Redskins bar in town. The 5th star is for the service. The bartenders are not only very sweet but are very consoling when your team is getting pummeled. The icing on the cake is the inexpensive prices for drinks.
author: Roger H.

description: I miss this place so much! They are bicycle friendly which is important for me when I need to park my horse before I got my liquid induced lobotomy. Paul and his wife Simone made the place feel like home and the owner reminded me that it was good old San Franstinky every time her rolled through on one with a smile and the eye of the tiger. Good times tucked away on the out skirts of Touristville. If six stars were possible this place would have one for keeping it real. Very rarely do I wake up on someones couch staring at he ceiling wondering where I am at and how I got there which is a testament to the quality of the drinks there. Order the "Strong Island," tighten up your helmet chin strap and wait for the rotation of the Earth to slow down so you don't fall over and you will have officially been Red Jackedup...
author: Muhammad R.

description: I love red jacks!!!!! Especially Shawna Marie and her margaritas :)!!!!
author: Karen P.

description: Great place for a drink and everyone is very cool to talk with.
author: John W.

description: Small bar but relaxed atmosphere. I saw woman with her retriever in the bar. It was freaking awesome. The dog was well behaved and super friendly. I guess that is how they roll in San Francisco.
author: Kavan Y.

description:
Great place. Good selection of beers on tap. You can't expect every bar to have every micro you want but they do a good job of having an excellent selection. 

Seems to be a locals place as everyone there seemed to know everyone else, but they were all very friendly. 

Mixed drinks are stiff. That's a plus and the bartenders and owners are very nice people. Another plus. I can't stress that enough. The staff here are really very friendly and helpful. 

On Superbowl Sunday they had a lot of fun stuff going on and everyone was having a good old time. They had a BBQ to raise money for  cause and everyone was enjoying themselves. 

This is a place that I would go to if I was meeting up with some friends later in the night and I wanted to get a drink, kick back, watch some sports and lounge until it was time to meet up. 

I would call it a neighborhood bar rather than a dive bar. 

Recommended.
author: Maec W.

description: Not a bad little place.  Generous drinks; good prices.  Not the sweetest-smelling place I've ever been, but friendly service and congenial crowd.
author: Greg M.

description: Not anything too special, although the bartenders were really nice.  I dont know if it was just because it was St. Patrick's day but the other patrons in the bar were really creepy, to the point that one couple of guys had to get kicked out because they wouldn't stop bothering us.  After that happened the girl that kicked them out told us that we shouldn't have enticed them with our sexuality, whatever the eff that means.  I had fun because it was my best friends birthday, but not a place a would hurry back to return to.
author: Karen S.

description: Best place EVER to watch the Boston Celtics play!  I am a huge fan of the C's, and I can't believe I just discovered this place today!  It's nice to be surrounded with fellow Boston fans.  (Drinks were cheap too!)
author: Anastasia E.

description: Cool neighborhood bar just a few blocks from the Pier.  The type of place after just one or two visits the bartender knows your name and drink.  They also always have great daily specials.  The Red Jack Saloon defiantly has the right characteristics to truly earn all five stars.
author: Rashid n.

description: I am a big fan of The Red Jack Saloon. Its been a while since I have been in to hang out, but its a great place to Throw back a couple with a few friends. If you are a Patriots or Redsox fan even better.  There are plenty of TV's to catch whatever game is on. Dart Boards, Juke Box, and a patio in the back for all you smokers out there... The owners are awesome and can't wait to have you stop in for a drink, or two, or three...haha
author: Miguel V.

description: I imagine if I docked in SF that I could walk 3 blocks away from the tourist herd and find this place full of real characters, after work crowds, and a super nice staff, I would count that as a good trip. Luckily, I work 2 blocks from this place and Red Jacks has turned into the after work spot for a lot of offices in the area. Mark is the fantastic loud owner hailing from Boston and he makes you feel at home. There is even a small outside area in back for drinking, smoking or BBQing. The locals here are a great and friendly bar stock and the owners and staff are so nice. PBRs and Budweisers in the bottle and some of the fancy stuff on tap. Cheap hard stuff, plenty of places to sit, board games and darts. Winner!
author: William R.

description: Gotta love it!  Great bartenders...  Great Drinks...  and games!  All it needs it a shuffle board table.  It is handy also since my guy lives upstairs!  Cheers...
author: Kris K.

description: Is there a place to rate bartenders? Laurie deserves 10 stars.
author: Steve H.

description: Good after-work dive bar to get some drinks, watch a game, and throw darts.  Nothin fancy, gets busy/very loud when there's a big game on.
author: M R.

description: I love this bar.  Its pure mellow, laid back, unpretentious bliss.  The bartenders there are so nice and cool, they know what they are doing, and actually seem to really like their job. The bartenders come in on there nights off.  Everyone there is there to drink and chill and talk.  There are a million board games, wi fi, great music selection on the juke box.  There is a  nice patio in the back too as well. I didnt think i would ever give the five star, but I cant think of a single problem with this bar.
author: Mary R.

description:
Visiting a friend who lived literally upstairs from the bar, every Sunday you can't not hear the fun going on at Red Jack.  I don't know who Jack is or why he was so red that they had to name a bar after him, but that's beside the point.

Finally last Sunday evening, my friend and I decided it was time to see what all of the noise was about.  Upon entering the saloon, Mark (the former owner) greeted us with a very fun, outgoing personality.  He bought us our first drink and maybe more because we drank at least 10 beers between us and the tab came out to $23.  Now THAT, my friends, is what I call economic stimulus!  They also included us in a round of shots, even though we were the only two in the place who didn't know anyone else.  That, my friends, is what I call Bostonian hospitality.

Everyone there was very outgoing and friendly with lots of great saloon personality.  All this and the fact that Darwin Coon, former Alcatraz inmate, frequents this place makes it a must for any passers by or locals.  The regulars are big time darts athletes.  I would have joined their league if I didn't live two hours away.

I would have given it 5 stars if there were more hot chics in there on Sunday night.
author: Bob S.

description: Very accommodating bartender, great drinks, and nice folks at this place.  Came here on a whim (thanks Yelp) and couldn't be happier!
author: Tom T.

description: As far as dive bars go, this is a pretty good place. I think they have three (?) plasmas in the place and it makes for easy viewing, esp on Saturdays when I'm in the mood to watch UCLA football. :) The crowds get pretty loud at night though, which is a pain for me cause I live in the next building over... Meh, but it's a bar, I'd expect there to be noise.
author: Simon L.

description: Be you old, be you young, be you a long-haired chihuahua named "Schnitzel", this is the saloon for you. Drinks are reasonable and there's a killer internet jukebox with almost any song your little puppy dog heart desires. If you just want to keep up those tired, old feet and don't mind the man farting on the stool next to you, you're good to go.
author: Katelin H.

description: Hit this bar after work with some friends.  Nice place and good drink specials.  Sam Adams are only three bucks when there's a red sox game on.  A good bar for a rainy day or whenever there's a game on...
author: Nate V.

description: We heard really good things about this place, so we went out of our way to check it out.  I have two words: DIVE BAR.  Great for a casual weeknight drink, but don't expect much.  The bartender was sort of rude, finishing her conversation with bar customers for about 5 minutes before even greeting us.  My Stella was skunky, and that is a dealbreaker for a beer lovin' girl like me.
author: J B.

description:
OK.  Here's the deal.  I really love Red Jacks... but I also think that no normal person frequents the same bar as much as I go to Red Jacks.  I am a woman who loves variety, but when you do theatre and get out of a show at 10:30 pm every Fri/Sat and 4:30 pm on Sunday...sometimes the first thing you want is just a drink.  Red Jacks is great at providing you with strong, cheap drinks and a bag of chips...especially near Pier 39 where everything else is stupid expensive and served in measured pours.  I also love that Red Jacks has the Fun Finder game where you have to find the difference between pictures of 2 naked woman...man, I get stuck in that game quite frequently.  They also have plenty of board games (which I love) and you can order out for pizza whenever.  Why not give it a 5 star rating if I love everything about it, you ask?  Because I am just so damn bored of coming here every Fri/Sat that I am driving myself crazy.  

So...if you wanna know where to find me...go to Red Jacks every Fri/Sat at 11pm...and I'll be there...again and again...and still getting carded by the same bartender every week too....sigh.
author: Jennifer E.

description: Great neighborhood dive bar.  As mentioned, it has Frogger, darts, tons of board games and a crazy Internet juke box.  Usually full of locals with a few random tourists happening by.  If you don't like this bar, then the jerk store is probably running out of you.
author: John S.

description: After passing by this place many times, we finally ventured inside last week, what a great find!  Red Jack is a great dive/sports bar.  The drinks are cheap, and they have specials every night of the week.  The atmosphere is down-to-earth and unpretentious (unlike many SF bars).  The staff and regulars are all friendly and fun.  They have darts, a juke box, and lots of TV's.  I will definitely be coming back in the future.
author: Karen L.

description: This is a great bar for whiling away an afternoon. They have darts, video games, pinball, board games - plenty to keep yourself entertained. There's also a back patio to catch the SF sun if it decides to make an appearance. Check it out!
author: Sarah R.

description: If you're looking for a place to watch Football, Red Jack is a great choice.  I've lived literally around the corner from this place for about 5 months and never walked in, but I'll definitely be back.  The owners and employees are friendly and they serve up some great drinks.  Our first round was on the owner and later he bought a round of shots for the bar.  Can't ask for much more than that!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Sweet eight pound, six ounce newborn baby Jesus, this place is the best neighborhood bar EVER (and it's not even in my neighborhood!).  It's not a glam bar, so if there's anyone reviewing this place that gets all snooty about "ambiance" they can kiss it. 

Everyone is very nice, the atmosphere is really cozy, relaxed, and fun. Plus, they have games, a dartboard and a jukebox -- so you don't have to worry about a crappy DJ!  Plus plus, the bathrooms are impeccable! No one pees on the seats and there's always enough TP -- even when it's busy.

I've spent my fair share of days and nights (some of which I don't remember very clearly), and have always had a good time. And the bartenders always make sure I get home ok :)

They even have heart - one of their bartenders fell ill, and they regularly hold fund raisers for the charity they've set up for him! 

Come for the Sox (or the Giants), come for the Irish Car Bombs, come for the fun!
author: January P.

description: Nestled in along Bay street near the corner of Stockton, this great little neighborhood hangout is certainly a gem. Great locals and super friendly staff make for a perfect after work spot to grab a couple of drinks. If you are a Bostonian transplant and need a place to catch up on the Sox or the Pats, this is your spot. They always have the games on and even have a "Green Monster" painted on the wall of the patio out back. Of course they are also fans of the local sports scene, and will certainly try to accomodate other fans if there is a game you really want to see. Different drink specials every day during happy hour and they sometimes even have something cooking to take care of the munchies. Say Howdy to Laurie the owner when you stop by...she is a sweetie.
author: Manny V.

description: Such a great bar.  Wish I lived closer to this place.  perfect place to watch the Red Sox play.  Owners are awesome and the drink specials are even better.  Just wish I lived closer.
author: Shawn S.

description: stop number 2 on a random sunday bar crawl. nice bar, lots of seating, lots of tvs to watch whatever games are on, bartenders were nice. they had an "all you can eat" bbq going if you donated $5. it looked like they had an outdoor patio seating area in the back but i didn't venture out there because i didn't want to get sucked in to getting some food. it smelled great though. i would come back if i was in the area.
author: Linda N.

description: If you're looking for a lively bar with a rowdy crowd to watch the playoffs with, this is not the place! A very sorry excuse for a Red Sox bar that will leave you surely disappointed. Worst sports bar I have EVER been to and not just because the bartenders are thick and and unattractive.
author: Vicky V.

description: If you ever find yourself down at the Wharf--against your will or otherwise--you owe it to yourself to drop into this little gem, a quintessential neighborhood bar under the red awning on Bay Street just east of Stockton.  The bartenders are friendly, real people, as are the rest of the people you'll run into in the joint.  Daily drink specials--including Bloody Mary's on the weekends, when you need them most--are a highlight, as is the stellar jukebox and the open-air space out back.  Tell Mark and Laurie that Drew sent you --and that I said "hey"--and I bet they may even hook you up with a free drink.
author: Drew W.

description: Total dive bar on Bay in North Beach.  Definitely a neighborhood watering hole kind of feel.  The drinks are pretty cheap.  The staff is always really friendly and they bought me a drink last time just because I told them my birthday had just past.  That's what I'm talking about.
author: Allison P.

description: So I have been walking past this place for years and yesterday I decided to check it out.  Talk about some friendly people!  Not only were the "regulars" cool, but the bartender literally bought the entire bar a round on the house....and the place was packed!  I have only seen that happen in movies!  Anyway, they have a cool little outdoor patio and a Ms. PacMan/Galaga video game in the corner so I was pretty much in heaven....
author: Barrett F.

description:
i thought this place would be a lot more fun.  but i guess it was friday right after work, and we weren't in the financial district and not really by anything actually.  

their beer special for happy hour was alright, but it was only red hook. they advertised as a good special effen black cherry and soda for $6.75.  which is not a good deal.

they did have lots of games, which was fun.  bc i love games.  and it's pretty cool they have a back patio, but it was small.

the bartenders were really nice.  if it wasn't so far away from my house i'd think about going more often, but definitely not worth the trip out there.
author: jessie h.

description: Cool little neighborhood bar that has FROGGER!  Yes, FROGGER!  Usually an interesting mix of people in there, and the service is friendly.
author: Erica G.

description: i love dive bars so it gets at least a 4.  our bartender was drunk but friendly.  i wasn't there long enough to really give fellow yelpers a true review, but i'll go back so wait for an update...
author: Hammer Time H.

description: Are you stuck dragging some out of town friends around town, and now they have you out at Fisherman's Wharf?  Head to the Red Jack on Bay Street and grab a cocktail or five at this unpretentious bar.  The bar is no frills, but the drinks are tasty.  Extra points for the killer jukebox selection.
author: Robert R.

description: A good laid back bar in north beach. Doesn't get crowded and it has darts and a bunch of other games floating around (like trivial pursuit and connect 4)
author: Ossama A.

description: I used to work in a building in the Wharf and know that there are very few places that cater to the non-tourist crowd. Red Jack Saloon is one of the exceptions. The place is laid back with decent prices and isn't terribly crowded. It does the trick for the after work needs.
author: Jenn G.

description: I love this little bar. It is cozy, affordable, and quite comfortable. My fiancé and I fell in love with this place last year when we visited SF, and now I  am compelled to write a review because it is that awesome. The drinks are more reasonable than most KS bars, and the staff can't be beat. Nicole is a sweetheart and cured fiancé of his hiccups... For awhile. If I am ever lucky enough to live in SF, this bar will be at least a weekly occurrence.
author: Katie P.

description: best bar in town!  'nough said
author: Christina O.

description: This place is a great little bar.  The drinks are cheap, the people are great, and best of all:  its the only Redskins bar in SF!  Hail!
author: Angel A.

description:
I am a recent addition to SF. My first week at my new job a few people from work invited me to this quaint dive bar.  It  was on that first night that it immediately reminded me of that kind of home-y, "Cheers-esque" pub where the bartender always remembers your name and your drink and serves it with the same warmth and welcoming smile as they did on the very first visit.  While Nicole is usually the one that keeps the Stellas coming, Nick and Mike are equally as friendly with all the patrons, whether they're working or just enjoying a brew like the rest of us.  These people, their friendliness and off-the-cuff humor made my boyfriend and I instantly fall in love with this place.  My only qualm would be that this is a Red Sox bar, being a native New Yorker...well you can understand. : ) However...These are West Coast Sox fans, no offense Red Jacks, that just means we can forgive each other for our baseball teams and drink together in harmony.  

This is so far the best place for an uncomplicated after work adult beverage where you can relax play Jenga, sing along to Journey on the Juke Box and meet the kind of down to earth people you feel like you've known your whole life.  Thanks Nicole, Mike and Nick for helping us strangers find our own little nook of SF to call our own.
author: Cassie P.
